casebody.data:
Richard M. SNOWDEN, Administrator of the Estate of Ernest Lee Smith, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 7338. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Jan. 11, 1938. Marcus C. Redwine, of Winchester, Ky., and Perry B. Miller, of Louisville, Ky., for appellant. J. T. Metcalf, of Winchester, Ky., for the United States.

Before MOORMAN and HICKS, Circuit Judges, and HAMILTON, District Judge. v

PER CURIAM.

The law and facts of this cause having been submitted to the trial court without a jury, and the appellant not having made any request for specific findings of fact or law, it is ordered that the judgment be affirmed on the authority of Rose v. United States, 6 Cir., 69 F.2d 966, Thomas E. Basham Co. v. Lucas, 6 Cir., 30 F.2d 97, and Fleischmann Const. Co. v. United States, 270 U.S. 349, 46 S.Ct. 284, 70 L.Ed. 624.
